meanings.definition: The lowest floor of a building, partly or entirely below ground level.
meanings.sent1: The basement is where we keep our old toys.
meanings.sent2: I store my seasonal clothes in the basement.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally locked myself in the basement while looking for a flashlight.
meanings.sent4: Her love for reading was built on the basement of her childhood home.
meanings.sent5: The basement smelled of damp earth and memories.

meanings.definition: A storage room or area in the basement of a building.
meanings.sent1: The basement is full of boxes and old furniture.
meanings.sent2: We found a hidden passage behind the shelves in the basement.
meanings.sent3: I joked that the basement was so full, it could qualify as a second-hand store.
meanings.sent4: The basement was a treasure trove of forgotten family heirlooms.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the basement felt like diving into a time capsule.

meanings.definition: The foundation or basis of something.
meanings.sent1: Trust is the basement of any strong relationship.
meanings.sent2: Education forms the basement of a successful career.
meanings.sent3: His sense of humor was the basement of his popularity in school.
meanings.sent4: Kindness serves as the basement for a harmonious community.
meanings.sent5: Hard work is the basement upon which dreams are built.
